intro: Ketmia trionum, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to Tanzania and Kenya. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its dense, velvety foliage and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a compact shrub, reaching heights of up to 30 centimeters. Its flowers are usually violet or purple in color, with five petals and a distinctive spurred shape. Ketmia trionum is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
